notes: Flagship luxury sedan first generation. Features VH45DE V8 (Nissan's first V8) with aluminum block and four-valve DOHC design. Advanced active suspension system. Rear-wheel drive only. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti Q45 article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Second generation flagship sedan. Downsized to 4.1L VH41DE V8. Features advanced electronics and luxury appointments. Rear-wheel drive only. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti Q45 article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Luxury coupe and convertible based on Nissan Leopard F31. Features VG30E V6 with single overhead cam. Rear-wheel drive only. Available as coupe or convertible. Production ended in 1992. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti M article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Entry-level compact luxury sedan based on Nissan Primera P10. Features SR20DE engine with variable valve timing. Front-wheel drive with multi-link independent suspension. Available with manual or automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti G article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Mid-size luxury sedan based on Nissan Leopard J Ferie Y32. Features VG30DE V6 with variable valve timing. Distinctive rounded styling. Rear-wheel drive with multi-link suspension. Production ended in 1997. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti J30 article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Mid-size luxury sedan based on Nissan Cefiro/Maxima A32. Features VQ30DE V6 with variable valve timing. Front-wheel drive only. Power increased to 227 hp for 1999-2001 models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti I article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Infiniti's first SUV based on Nissan Pathfinder R50. Body-on-frame construction with VG33E V6. Part-time 4WD system with low-range transfer case. Available in 2WD or 4WD configurations. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti QX4 article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Second generation compact luxury sedan based on Nissan Primera P11. SR20DE engine features variable valve timing. Front-wheel drive only. Updated styling and interior. Data sourced from Wikipedia Infiniti G article, January 17, 2025 revision.
